children.value: Hummingbot has been successfully tested with the following specifications:
Other Linux installations: Debian GNU/Linux 9, CentOS 7, Amazon Linux 2 AMI
A reliable internet connection is critical to keeping Hummingbot connected to exchanges.
For experienced and technical users, we recommend setting up a cloud instance and installing the Docker version or from source. This enables Hummingbot to run 24/7.

Using Hummingbot as a long-running service can be achieved with the help of cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure. You may read our blog about running
, installing Docker takes up around 500 MB of storage space and 4 GB for Hummingbot Docker image. We tested to install and run Hummingbot on these free to lowest machine types.
These instances are pre-loaded with system files that take up around 1.2 GB, so we recommend having at least

Check with the relevant cloud provider for instructions on how to set up a new Virtual Machine Instance on each major cloud platform.
We publish a new release of Hummingbot approximately once every month.
